title.rendered: 16 Best Things To Do In Raleigh

content.rendered:
Raleigh, known as the “City of Oaks” for its many oak trees, is the capital city of North Carolina. It’s a history-rich city filled with endless opportunities to explore and enrich yourself, as you’ll read below! Additionally, restaurants in Raleigh have an exciting mix of traditional southern food and global flavors. Certainly, these reasons also make it a great place to live and experience the unique lifestyle the metropolis offers. Read on to discover the best things to do in Raleigh!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Raleigh

Exciting Outdoor Activities in Raleigh

1. Pullen Park

Pullen Park is an excellent nature park and one of the best places to visit in Raleigh. Complete with boat rentals, hiking trails, and a miniature railway- you’re in for a wholesome adventure!

Website

Related: How To Make A Travel Budget & Stick To It?

2. Yates Mill County Park

If you love walking or biking on trails, you’ll love the fact that the Raleigh area has 180 miles of the greenway to explore. Likewise, Yates Mill County Park offers the best things to do in Raleigh! You can indulge in countless events focused on natural, cultural, and recreational opportunities.

  • Hours of Operation: Open Daily- 8 a.m. to Sunset
  • Pricing: Adults – $7, Senior – $4, Youth – $4. Children 6 and under are free.
Events

3. Mordecai Historic Park

Mordecai House is the centerpiece of Mordecai Historic Park, adjacent to the Historic Oakwood neighborhood. Moreover, it’s the oldest house in Raleigh in its original location.

Website

Don’t Miss Out on the Sports Scene in Raleigh

1. Adventure Landing

This awesome one-stop destination cannot be ignored, because it combines all the best things to do in Raleigh! You’ll sense it as soon as you arrive. Further, the fun, lively vibe only adds on with each activity you try!

Tickets

2. TreeRunner Adventure Park

This thrilling aerial adventure covers all the best things to do in Raleigh! It has over 70 exciting obstacles, ropes courses and zip lines, three difficulty levels, and seven different courses! Indeed, there’s plenty to explore at this outdoor adventure park.

Website

Related: How to Minimize Expenses While on Vacation

3. Frankie’s

If you’re looking to cover the fun places to visit in Raleigh, head to Frankie’s Fun Park! You’ll get access to mini-golf, batting cages, an arcade, a drop zone, bumper boats, a rock wall, and more!

Tickets
Website

Must Visit Museums in Raleigh

1. North Carolina Museum of Art

A must-visit location in the city if you are keen to learn about art and culture. Moreover, you can purchase free timed tickets prior to your visit. The rotating exhibits at this museum are very inspiring and always highly anticipated.

Tickets
Plan Your Visit

2. Marbles Kids Museum

Truly, there’s no limit to the best things to do in Raleigh for children! At Marbles, play is fun and educational, with innovative hands-on exhibits, and award-winning programs.

Related: 5 New York Hiking Trails to Add to Your Traveling Bucket-list

Website
Plan Your Visit

3. North Carolina Museum of Natural Sciences

The North Carolina Museum of Natural Sciences is the largest museum of its kind in the Southeast. This museum is one of the best places to visit in Raleigh, especially for history and science lovers.

  • Hours of Operation: Tuesday–Sunday, 10am–5pm
Website
Events

Cultural Places to Visit in Raleigh

1. North Carolina Opera

While looking to experience the best things to do in Raleigh, don’t forget to visit the North Carolina Opera. In fact, it is dedicated to presenting operatic performances at the highest level throughout the Triangle.

Tickets

Related: How to Make Money for the Holidays – Pandemic Edition

2. Historic Oakwood

Historic Oakwood is a leafy, residential neighborhood known for well-preserved Victorian houses. If you’re eager to explore early 20th century homes in a variety of styles, from Queen Anne to neoclassical and Craftsman, head to this neighborhood!

Website

3. Raleigh Little Theatre

One of the best things to do in Raleigh is to attend a performing arts venue! It’s a community theatre that produces 10 to 11 full productions annually. Further, it conducts youth and adult theatre education programs.

Explore Popular Bars, Shopping Centers & Restaurants in Raleigh

1. Fox Liquor Bar

This bar describes itself as a “subterranean drinking den” that serves both classic and contemporary drinks. Signature cocktails, wines and craft beers, and light cuisine such as sliders, are served in this elegant setting.

Website

2. The Big Easy

The Big Easy is one of the best restaurants in Raleigh. Here, you’ll find delectable food with a boisterous ambiance that won’t disappoint. Cajun culture and cuisine are combined with southern hospitality at this restaurant and bar.

Website

3. FOUNDATION Raleigh

This low-key basement pub serves innovative drinks, local craft beer, and has an industrial vibe. Moreover, FOUNDATION is among restaurants in Raleigh that serve bar food paired with their homemade libations. Certainly, one of the best places to visit in Raleigh for a contented meal.

Website

Related: The Eco-Life: How to Save Energy While on Vacation

4. Ridgewood Shopping Center

The Ridgewood Shopping Center is an eclectic mix of independent, locally-owned shops that are best known for wide-range shopping. Moreover, its extensive selection of high-end party decorations and gift items make it among the best places to visit in Raleigh to buy a souvenir.

Website

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find the best things to do in Raleigh? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we’ll help you find your perfect match!
